vacancy.name: Java разработчик
vacancy.description: Требования: 4+ года опыта работы с Java 8+ или Kotlin 4+ года опыта работы с Spring и 2+ год работы с Spring Boot. Опыт работы с системами на микросервисной архитектуре (Spring Cloud, Kubernetes, Openshift или аналоги). Опыт работы с Docker. Опыт работы с 3-мя любыми из следующих технологий NoSQL (MongoDB, Elasticsearch, аналоги) SQL (PostgreSQL, Oracle, аналоги) Брокеры сообщений (Kafka, RabbitMQ, аналоги) Reactive programming (RxJava, Project Reactor) Cache (Redis, Hazelcast). Настройка CI/CD (GitlabCI, Jenkins, аналоги). Настройка средств мониторинга (Zabbix, Prometheus). Настройка средств логирования (Graylog, ELK). Будет хорошо, если кандидат: Знает все технологии из первого пункта; Участвовал в проработке архитектуры и может объяснить все решения на своем проекте; Готов драйвить техническое развитие систем, а не просто следовать текущим стандартам; Имеет дружеские отношения с DevOps, пайплайны, контейнеризация и оркестрация, Linux; Понимает микросервисную архитектуры и устройство распределенных систем; Участвовал в подборе и онбординге новых сотрудников; Умеет и хочет писать технические статьи. Развиваться и развивать коллег/комьюнити. Проводить как разовые тренинги, так и планировать долгие обучения. Что предстоит делать: Использовать самый современный технологический стэк для создания FinTech решений; Разрабатывать приложения, которые масштабируются на все дистанционные каналы банка (интернет-банк, мобильные приложения, платёжные сервисы и многое другое); Взаимодействовать с различными командами разработки, Data Science, поддержки и другими (поэтому необходимы хорошие навыки коммуникации или желание их развивать); Вносить свой вклад в развитие архитектуры, делать новое и оценивать старое.

Sample6 CONTROL: это решение для упреждающего управления рисками для защиты брендов компаний. Он может визуализировать заводы компаний, риски и EMP для уверенности, что процесс находится под контролем и в соответствии с требованиями. Sample6 CONTROL обеспечивает: Улучшение соответствия требованиям FSMA, возможность масштабирования нескольких предприятий, автоматическое отслеживание, визуализацию всего предприятия, автоматизированное документирование, систематизированную отчетность. Обязанности: когда я присоединился к команде, проект находился в стадии завершения разработки основного функционала. Я начал работу в начале следующего этапа. На втором этапе разработки я исправил ошибки, внедрил новые функции на основе спецификаций BA и обеспечил хорошее тестовое покрытие для существующей кодовой базы. Также я интегрировал приложение со сторонней лабораторией LIMS. На третьем этапе разработки я перевел проект с версии Grails 2.1 на версию 2.5. Все среды тестирования перенесены со старого промежуточного сервера на Amazon EC2 и RDS. Интегрированный инструмент качества Code Climate. Я разработал и внедрил критически важный для бизнеса рабочий процесс для обработки исправлений. Тех. стек: Groovy/Grails, Hibernate/GORM, отчеты Jasper, отчеты Birt, GSP, Coffeescript, React, Redux, Spock, Geb, Liquibase, Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, MySQL, Amazon S3, Tomcat, Teamcity, Apache Docker, Code Climate , Желтоперый, Гит XGSI: Транспортная компания США. Эта компания использует множество ИТ-решений для бизнес-целей. Обязанности: миграция всех устаревших технологий на современные. Тех. стек: Java 11, Spring Boot, Azure, Twillio и т. д. Веб-приложение Stork Shipping: Веб-сайт, на который клиенты могут прийти, найти и быстро получить расценки на транспортную этикетку. Они могут приобрести этикетку и распечатать ее из веб-браузера. Они также могут получить электронное письмо к ним Традиционно создание этикетки требует множества вариантов выбора и деталей. Сервис пытается упростить этот процесс, запрашивая минимальный объем информации на основе наших знаний о том, что на самом деле требуется операторам связи для создания этикеток и выставления счетов. Тех. стек: Java 11, Spring Boot, Streety Smarts для проверки адреса, Shippo для получения котировок цен на доставку, для покупки актуальных этикеток, Stripe для авторизации и захвата кредитной карты Sendgrid для отправки PDF-меток по электронной почте, AWS для веб-хостинга и т. д. База данных MySQL — журнал транзакций и отгрузочных этикеток, адрес электронной почты клиента и т. д. Правила продажи: веб-сервис для расчета текущей фазы продажи (opensale, раздача, начало анонса и т. д.) для запрашиваемого продукта. Веб-сервис построен на Spring Boot и использует технологии Webflux и Reactor. Лимиты заказа: микро-веб-сервис для управления различными типами ограничений/правил для разных типов продуктов.

experienceItem.description: Small clarification: I finished working in IBS on July of 2020 but carried on in another legal entity, so it’s equivalent to working in IBS. 1 There were two big main projects and several secondary. These two main projects were to make service for Moskow Government Fund of Obligatory Medical Insurance that will allow to account medical services and will allow medical organizations (MO) to send bills for obligatory insurance medical organizations (OIMO) and receive answers of applying or rejecting their bills. The first project consisted in managing of medical services and bills. The second project was another system of managing personal data of patients. I was working only at first project. The first system that called PUMP had to receive personal data from second system that called ERZL. At the first time it was very problematic project that contained a lot of bugs. Project contained 20 modules and in compiled state was consumpted plenty of disk space, it's minimum system requirements were 3Gbyte of RAM. The project was built with micro services architecture and this architecture was used extremely unsuccessful. Talking in details about modules and architecture I can say that modules were tightly coupled, they were communicated via some self-developed mechanism inherited by us from previous team, that mechanism was very complicated. If one module wasn't work, all system wasn't work. Mechanism of weaving and starting up modules was very complicated too. Pieces of functionality called features in this project. It was inherited self-invented name from previous development team. Modules were communicated via this features with each other. Because of this system became having high level of slowness in production under load from users. When I worked with this project I read a lot of foreign code and was trying to understand meaning of it. At the first time my responsibilities were fixing bugs in this project. This project didn't have good organized mechanisms of logging, that's why it was very hard to understand what going wrong and it was very hard to debug it. The process of building the project was consumpted about 10 minutes and process of starting the server was consumpted about 10 minutes especially long time was consumpted in debug mode of the server (starting in jpda mode). I was trying to make cross-module integration tests and I had some success — I extremely decreased time of one iteration of fixing bugs for myself from 30 minutes to 1 or 2 minutes, but it was hard to support them in working condition because every time somebody was changing modules and was adding or removing some logic, it was disadvantage of this approach. Our team contained the following people: director, project manager, 3 client developers (ExtJS), one very highly professional analytic, two testers, one team lead-developer, me as developer and 4 other developers. In condition of government contract we had to run our systems in production exploitation very early when system wasn't ready for it. We had a lot of troubles and we had plenty of overtime working till night. As soon as we began production exploitation of our system we had understood that besides big amount of bugs we had got a big problems with bill creation mechanism, it was extremely slow and had very sophisticated business logic and it was written in Java. Medical organizations were plugged to our system step-by-step, but not all in one time. It was really helpful for us. At the first time only small medical organizations were plugged and it was seemed no problems with bill creation, but when we had got one bigger medical organization that had about 10 thousand services per month we became having a big problems because creating and sending bills process was consumpted 13 hours. We had information that there were bigger medical organizations that were able to make more than 100 or 200 thousand services per month. My biggest achievement in this project was extremely improving this process and making it about 100 times faster. Main problem of this process consisted in different modules that was taking small pieces of information from database and web-services. Mostly they had losses of product ty in I/O operations. I decided that it was main problem. I allocated business logic and injected instead of previous data access objects other objects that already had contained previously downloaded information in collections that were taken beforehand as mass bulk operations. I introduced good logging, some reports creating with main information for users and developers, operation time measurement, saving program state in defined points of execution and special debug modes. When some error occurred I was able to start this process from closest point to error to fix it. I was able to take debug files and start debug process of creating bills on another computer. In first version product ty was increased in 38 times and in the last version it was increased in 100 times. When I had added multithreading it gave extra 15-20 percents of product ty increasing. Main ideas that allowed this productive improvements were bulk operations of reading and saving and putting the load from the database into the application servers. I think that it is the best improvement I have ever made at this work. Fundamental technologies: Spring, JAX-WS, JAX-RS, JPA, Hibernate. Application Server: Tomcat 7. Database: Oracle 11. 2 Integration with accountant system “Parus” (It’s some another “Parus” but not “Parus” I used to work in). It was a small project consisted in integration with external accountant system via WSDL-web services having also file transferring and rece ng using MTOM. Authentication and query logging principles were taken from library belonged to other project using aspects. Fundamental technologies: Spring, JAX-WS, Hibernate (only in attached library), JDBC. Database: Oracle 11. 3 Very small SMB file existence checking utility. The purpose of this utility is to check if the file existed on SMB filesystem and sent it to the external system if it wasn’t exist. Fundamental technologies: JDBC and SmbFiles. Database: Oracle 11. 4 Drug appointment integration utility. The simple utility that checks from time to time the task table in the database. If the start task exists, it takes entities than groups them and asks then another external service about drugs appointments, after it the utility puts results to the database. Main hacks are: reducing the number of queries through grouping, limitation the number of queries per second to external service as not to overload it and updating the database using ranges of ids contained equal results that allowed to reduce database input/output. Fundamental technologies: JDBC. Database: Oracle 11. 5 OpenEHR intergration utility. It’s utility that represents four different kinds of documents in four different kinds of OpenEHR documents and sends such documents to external service. OpenEHR is such a sophisticated Russian XML. The project contains builders of this documents and logic of managing and transmitting this data. The process of transmitting includes logic of signing obtained documents using external service of signing. Managing logic contains several threads and synchronization between all of them: configuration checking thread, task queue thread, document builder and transmitter threads, statistics thread, documents checking statuses threads and threads that make earlier transmitted documents deprecated if there is such necessity. Fundamental technologies: JDBC, OpenEHR. Database: Oracle 11.

1 Developing DICOM-server for Samara State Medical University. DICOM is a protocol of medical images interchange between medical devices. This project was a government contract of import substitution. There are foreign analogs, but theirs price is too high for Samara’s health care industry, about 3 million rubs (1$=60 rub now) per one license. This project depended on dcm4che implementation. Application Server had to implement functions of storing, searching, provision of saved images to other nodes in LAN and obtaining images from other DICOM-nodes. Fundamental technologies: JAX-WS, EclipseLink, JPA. Application Server: GlassFish 4.0. Database: Oracle; 8 Small project of generation 2D barcodes of PDF417 format for order’s blanks for patients laboratory researches. It was a small utility for existed MIS that was able to make 2D barcode. 9 Project of integration with Android and MIS. There was an idea to give to doctor a tablet PC in order to doctor during circumvention of patients was able to write different medical data about patient in electronic view that were put into MIS’s database. Project for Android was made by another programmer. I was participated in developing WAR-module of integration with Android based on JAX-RS. Fundamental technologies: JAX-RS. Application Server: GlassFish 4.0. Database: Oracle; 10 Project of integration with x-ray equipment via HL7v2 protocol for Kalinina hospital, the biggest hospital in Samara State. It was necessary to transfer proposals for research to roentgen device via HL7v2 protocol and also get and analyze answers from it. Fundamental technologies: HL7v2. Application Server: GlassFish 4.0; 11 Developing the program of automated installing and updating early developed application. It was necessary to develop utility for automated installing and updating early developed application. It was contained in itself small C++ utility for checking JDK/JRE installation and mail JavaSE module, that was allowed full installation and updating of existed program. Fundamental technologies: C++, HTTP GET/POST, JDBC, JavaFX. Database: Oracle. “Medservice-Volga”

Repairing and servicing of medical equipment. Types of equipment were wide: glucometers, cardiographs, different kinds of breathing equipment, stomatology chairs, photometers, blood analyzers (like MEK-6400), servicing of ultrasound equipment (Aloka), clorine generators, cavitation sink and other types of medical equipment. The main task was usually looking for a hardware issue and fixing it. Secondary task was site managing and developing using PHP5 and MySQL database.

The topic was one channel cardiograph. It was real device that took patient’s cardiogram and transmitted it to the computer via Bluetooth. It used to be quite new technology. BlueNiceComIII module was used to reach such opportunity. The main parts of cardiograph contained instrumental amplifier, analog to digital converter, controller for managing all parts of the device, different secondary components and bluetooth module. Computer program to display data was also developed. Program for controller was written on the controller specific kind of assembler. Computer program was also written on the assembler for Win32.
